articles.description: PARIS: A thriving hotspot of some 1.5 million Adelie penguins has been discovered on the remote Danger Islands in the east Antarctic, surprised scientists announced Friday. Just 160 kilometers (100 miles) away in the west Antarctic, the same species is in dec…

articles.author: ET EnergyWorld
articles.title: INNOVATION: Purple bacteria may help harvest green fuel from wastewater - ETEnergyworld.com
articles.description: The study showed that supplying electric current to purple phototrophic bacteria can recover nearly 100 per cent of carbon from any type of organic waste, while generating hydrogen gas for electricity production
articles.content: London: A purple bacteria -- which store energy from light -- can help harvest hydrogen fuel from sewage, and recover carbon from any type of organic waste, scientists have found. Organic compounds i… [+2688 chars]

articles.title: The Milky Way's big sister gets shrunk down to size - Nature.com
articles.description: The Andromeda galaxy might be only half as massive as thought.
articles.content:
The Andromeda galaxy, the closest to the Milky Way, might be more of a lightweight than astronomers thought.
Previous measurements have put Andromedas mass at about twice that of the Milky Way, alth… [+659 chars]
